intro: Howardia obtusata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a succulent shrub, with thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. Howardia obtusata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
